meanings.definition: A pole used to support a tent.
meanings.sent1: We placed the tentpoles firmly in the ground.
meanings.sent2: The tentpoles were made of strong metal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the tentpoles were trees to climb.
meanings.sent4: The tentpoles stood tall like guardians of the campsite.
meanings.sent5: The colorful tentpoles stood out against the green grass.

meanings.definition: A crucial or central element that holds something together or provides support.
meanings.sent1: Communication is a tentpole in any successful relationship.
meanings.sent2: Trust is one of the tentpoles of a strong friendship.
meanings.sent3: Laughter can be a surprising tentpole during difficult times.
meanings.sent4: Kindness acts as a tentpole in building a caring community.
meanings.sent5: Education serves as a tentpole for personal growth and development.
